organization.fullName: The First Affiliated Hospital of University of Science and Technology of China

identificationModule.briefTitle: Intravenous Tenecteplase Plus EVT Versus EVT Alone on 4.5 to 24 Hours After Basilar Artery Occlusion
identificationModule.officialTitle: Intravenous Tenecteplase Plus Endovascular Thrombectomy Versus Endovascular Thrombectomy Alone on 4.5 to 24 Hours After Stroke Due to Basilar Artery Occlusion -a Multicenter, Randomized Controlled, Clinical Trial

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of University of Science and Technology of China

leadSponsor.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of University of Science and Technology of China

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To assess the effect of intravenous tenecteplase plus endovascular thrombectomy (EVT) compared to EVT alone on 4.5 to 24 hours after stroke due to basilar artery occlusion.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Background and Rationale: Recently, two prospective multicenter RCT (ATTENTION and BAOCHE trials) have shown a significantly beneficial effect of EVT in patients with an acute symptomatic basilar artery occlusion. The EXTEND-IA TNK trial demonstrated that intravenous thrombolysis with tenecteplase is superior to alteplase before EVT for anterior circulation large vessel occlusion strokes. However, it is unclear whether intravenous tenecteplase bridging with EVT is superior to EVT alone in the extended window patients with basilar artery occlusion. Therefore, additional studies are needed to explore the potential benefit of intravenous tenecteplase in these patients.

Study design: Multicenter, prospective, controlled clinical trial with open-label treatment and blind outcome assessment (PROBE) of intravenous tenecteplase plus EVT versus EVT alone. The trial has observer blinded assessment of the primary outcome and neuroimaging at baseline and follow up.

conditions: Stroke Due to Basilar Artery Occlusion

armGroups.label: Intravenous tenecteplase+endovascular thrombectomy
armGroups.description: Patients will receive intravenous tenecteplase (0.25mg/kg, max 25mg) plus endovascular thrombectomy.

armGroups.label: Endovascular thrombectomy alone
armGroups.description: Patients will receive endovascular thrombectomy alone.

interventions.name: Tenecteplase
interventions.description: Patients will receive intravenous tenecteplase (0.25mg/kg, maximum 25mg, administered as a bolus over 5-10 seconds) before endovascular thrombectomy

interventions.name: Endovascular thrombectomy
interventions.description: The choice of endovascular thrombectomy strategy will be made by the treating neurointerventionist. All thrombectomy devices for endovascular treatment, which are approved by CFDA for this purpose, are allowed in the trial.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0-2 at day 90 (±14 days)
primaryOutcomes.description: modified Rankin scale (range, 0 to 6, with a score of 0 indicating no disability, 1 no clinically significant disability, 2 slight disability, 3 moderate disability but remaining able to walk unassisted, 4 moderately severe disability, 5 severe disability, and 6 death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0-3 at day 90 (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: modified Rankin scale (range, 0 to 6, with a score of 0 indicating no disability, 1 no clinically significant disability, 2 slight disability, 3 moderate disability but remaining able to walk unassisted, 4 moderately severe disability, 5 severe disability, and 6 death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ordinal Shift analysis of modified Rankin Score at day 90 (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: modified Rankin scale (range, 0 to 6, with a score of 0 indicating no disability, 1 no clinically significant disability, 2 slight disability, 3 moderate disability but remaining able to walk unassisted, 4 moderately severe disability, 5 severe disability, and 6 death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Score on the NIHSS at 24 hours
secondaryOutcomes.description: The NIHSS is an ordinal hierarchical scale to evaluate the severity of stroke by assessing a patient's performance. Scores range from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating a more severe deficit.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Score on the NIHSS at 5-7 days or discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: The NIHSS is an ordinal hierarchical scale to evaluate the severity of stroke by assessing a patient's performance. Scores range from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating a more severe deficit.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0-1 at day 90 (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: modified Rankin scale (range, 0 to 6, with a score of 0 indicating no disability, 1 no clinically significant disability, 2 slight disability, 3 moderate disability but remaining able to walk unassisted, 4 moderately severe disability, 5 severe disability, and 6 death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0-4 at day 90 (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: modified Rankin scale (range, 0 to 6, with a score of 0 indicating no disability, 1 no clinically significant disability, 2 slight disability, 3 moderate disability but remaining able to walk unassisted, 4 moderately severe disability, 5 severe disability, and 6 death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Score on the EuroQoL 5-dimensions 5-level (EQ5D-5L) at 90 days (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Health-related quality of life, assessed with EQ-5D-5L

secondaryOutcomes.measure: level of activities of daily living (Barthel index, BI) at 90 days (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Level of activities of daily living

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Successful reperfusion (Extended thrombolysis in cerebral infarction [eTICI] score 2b50-3) on digital substraction angiography (DSA) prior to thrombectomy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Evaluate effect of intravenous thrombolysis on reperfusion

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Successful reperfusion on final angiography of thrombectomy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Evaluate effect of thrombectomy on reperfusion
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 5 minutes at final angiography of thrombectomy

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Successful recanalization on CT or MR angiography within 72 hours
Infarct volume (Posterior Circulation Acute Stroke Prognosis Early Computed Tomography Score, PC-ASPECTS) evaluated on CT or MRI within 72 hours
secondaryOutcomes.description: PC-ASPECTS=10 indicates a normal scan, PC-ASPECTS=0 indicates early ischemic changes or hypoattenuation in all above territories. 1 or 2 points each are subtracted for early ischemic changes or hypoattenuation in: left or right thalamus, cerebellum or posterior cerebral artery territory, respectively (1 point); any part of midbrain or pons (2 points)

otherOutcomes.measure: Overall mortality at 7 (± 2 days) and 90 (± 14 days)

otherOutcomes.description: SICH means any hemorrhage with neurological deterioration, as indicated by an NIHSS score that was higher by ≥4 points than the value at baseline or the lowest value in the first 72 hours or any hemorrhage leading to death
